messages.message:
Hi Team,

During project creation file splitting is automatically turned off. So when creating multiple classes, a multi file document is of course classified as only one class. Have we considered/is it in the pipeline to include the file splitting option during project creation alongside the 'tables, checkboxes' options? Or when a second class is added prompt the user to check if they would like to turn file splitting on?

Hey Julia thanks for the feedback. The challenge is that not all projects may need classification, so to ask about splitting post upload during project creation may lead to some confusion.

However, it might make more sense when you go to create your first class.
I'm not sure if we've historically considered but its not on the current roadmap

That definitely makes sense especially since it takes longer to split the files so many users wouldn't like to see longer wait times on initial project creation.

Not sure how big of a pain point this is but thank you for acknowledging!
Yeah ofc. Lets keep a tab on this issue!
We already show this option when you click “Classify” after creating a class for the first time
Yeah i thought that too but I did see it for some reason on prod
@Serena unable to actually get to this modal
does at least one doc in your project have multiple pages?
i just created a project on prod, and i see the modal

Yeah I'm guessing the order of operations matter? I uploaded a few single page docs then created multiple classes then uploaded more docs for each of the new classes including some multipage documents,
you need to click “Classify” to see the modal
uploading docs doesn’t trigger the modal
It was automatically classified. Lets take this to chat so as not bombard Julia

ah i see what you’re saying - you clicked “Classify” for the first time when you only had single-page docs in your project

the modal only shows up if you’re clicking “Classify” for the first time AND if you have multi-page docs in your project
